abstracts.cdata!:
This report focuses on the achievements
            of forestry pastoral Project (RISEMP) in the pilot area of
            Costa Rica. Specifically, it focuses on the effect of the
            payment on the changes described in land use introduced by
            farmers, monitoring results of the present generation of
            environmental services, carbon sequestration and
            biodiversity increase in applications of the most
            predominant soil in the landscape. Study results also show
            that in the project area it was evident that water is a
            scarce resource and that the generation of the service was
            rebranded as being as very important to the people of the
            area. Finally, it compares the payment schemes corresponding
            to the currently RISEMP employed by the Payment for
            Ecosystem Services (PES) implemented by the National
            Forestry Financing Fund (FONAFIFO).
